text.p: Matches scheduled for this weekend in the French first division (standings in parentheses, all kick-off times GMT):
Saturday:
Nantes (6) v Bastia (3) 1900

Unbeaten in 20 league games, Nantes will be looking to improve their home form as they seek place in Europe. Having reduced tickets prices, Nantes have already sold 25,000. Bastia welcome back defender Sebastien Perez and midfielder Cyril Rool from suspension.
Montpellier (12) v Rennes (13) 1900

Veteran defender Franck Sauzee is doubtful for Montpellier, whose six-match unbeaten run has seen them climb out of relegation zone. Division's top scorer Stephane Guivarc'h is doubtful for Rennes who have yet to win away (two points in 14 games) and lost their unbeaten home record in last match.
Nancy (19) v Nice (20) 1900

Basement clash for which Nancy, in buoyant mood after winning both games on tour of Romania, are letting home fans in for free, seeking 20,000 plus crowd. French Cup quarter-finalists Nice continue to be hampered by injury to several players including Serbian midfielder Zoran Milinkovic.
Caen (18) v Lille (16) 1900

Relegation scrap with Polish midfielder Grzegorz Lewandowski doubtful for Caen after injury in French Cup third round loss at Guingamp last weekend. Lille defender Pascal Cygan is suspended after being sent off in French Cup defeat at home to Montpellier.
Cannes (14) v Metz (8) 1900
Another Cote d'Azur side plagued by injuries, Cannes will also be without suspended defender Romain Ferrier. Metz's Senegal striker Amara Traore and winger Frederic Arpinon are injured.
Strasbourg (4) v Bordeaux (5) 1900

Dress rehearsal for the April 12 League Cup final between two sides gunning for places in Europe and even second Champions' League spot behind title winners. Czech Republic defender Jan Suchoparek makes return from long-term injury. Bordeaux will be missing suspended Brazilian central defender Paulo Gralak, while France midfielder Ibrahim Ba could miss second game in row through injury.
Lens (15) v Le Havre (17) 1900
Lens defender Frederic Dehu and midfielder Marc-Vivien Foe of Cameroon are suspended, while Le Havre have forward Nicolas Huysman under suspension
Guingamp (11) v Marseille (9) 1900

Marseille, still looking for first away win of season, have Hamada Jambay back in defence after suspension, but striker Xavier Gravelaine begins three-match ban and midfielder Olivier Echouafni is also suspended. Guingamp are virtually at full strength.
Sunday:
Paris St Germain (2) v Lyon (10) 1730
PSG, held 0-0 by AEK Athens at Parc des Princes on Thursday,

PSG, held 0-0 by AEK Athens at Parc des Princes on Thursday, seek first home win in any competition since mid-November (four out of possible 15 points in league) against side who put them out of League Cup in December. Injury problems in defence may be worse after knock suffered by Paul Le Guen against AEK. Lyon have four players suspended including striker Franck Gava.
Monaco (1) v Auxerre (7) 1930

Potential champions meet title holders after mixed results in Europe. Monaco keeper Fabien Barthez has fractured cheekbone but will play with protective mask, while Emmanuel Petit is expected to return after missing 1-0 win at Newcastle through injury. Auxerre have lost midfielder Christian Henna for six weeks after injuring knee in 3-1 loss at Borussia Dortmund.
